update.description:
Some previous valgrind analysis identified some use of uninitialized variables `sa_flags` and `sa_mask` in the sigact structs. This can be reproduced with the following command:

~~~
valgrind --tool=memcheck gzserver --iters 10 --verbose
~~~

and shows the [following error](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/417c40a5489fb4bdb3f2#file-sigact_valgrind-L40-L50):

~~~
Syscall param rt_sigaction(act->sa_mask) points to uninitialised byte(s)
   at 0x5CF8E4A: __libc_sigaction (sigaction.c:64)
   by 0x4E50D40: gazebo::Server::Run() (Server.cc:471)
   by 0x4022A8: main (server_main.cc:40)
 Address 0xffefff838 is on thread 1's stack

Syscall param rt_sigaction(act->sa_flags) points to uninitialised byte(s)
   at 0x5CF8E4A: __libc_sigaction (sigaction.c:64)
   by 0x4E50D40: gazebo::Server::Run() (Server.cc:471)
   by 0x4022A8: main (server_main.cc:40)
 Address 0xffefff828 is on thread 1's stack
~~~

This initializes those struct fields. It is not urgent.

* [no-gpu build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/489/) is clean
* [trusty nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/383/) has just one spurious test failure
* [homebrew build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/377/) is fine
update.title: Initialize sigact struct fields that valgrind said were being used uninitialized
